stdGYS types, operators and conversions

stdGYS types, operators and conversions

  • bool:
    • binary:
      • =
      • == != < > <= >= && ||
    • prefix:
      • ! +

  • double, int:
    • binary:
      • = += -= *= /=
      • %= for int
      • + - * /
      • % for int
      • == != < > <= >= && ||
    • postfix:
      • ++ --
    • prefix:
      • + - ! ++ --

  • char:
    • binary:
      • =
      • +
      • * (e.g. 'x'*3=="xxx")
      • == != < > <= >=

  • string:
    • binary:
      • =
      • +
      • * (e.g. "xyz"*3=="xyzxyzxyz")
      • *=
      • +=
      • == != < > <= >=
      • "const" []

  • vector:
    • binary:
      • =
      • []
      • +
      • +=
    • postfix range operator: vector(low~up)

  • function:
    • binary:
      • =
    • postfix:
      • ( [args] )[:thread]
        Note:
        This operator executes function's code in the context (gets language definition from the script), creates self constant "in the body" during function call, with thread specifier function is called in a separate thread and operator returns its handle (int value).
    • and some useful built-in functions:
      • defunc [global] ret_type [@]funcname(...) { ... }
        Note:
        IT IS THE SAME AS : [global] function [@]fname=~ret_type(...) { ... }
      • fn ret_type(...) { ... }
        Note:
        IT IS THE SAME AS : function( ~ret_type (...) { ... } )

Conversions:

Note:
! - conversion with script-warning.
  • double -> int!
  • double -> bool!

  • int -> double
  • int -> bool!

  • bool -> int
  • bool -> double

  • bool -> string
  • int -> string
  • double -> string

  • char -> string
  • string -> char!

  • vector -> bool!
  • vector -> int!
  • vector -> double!
  • vector -> char!
  • vector -> function!

  • bool -> vector of bool
  • int -> vector of int
  • double -> vector of double
  • char -> vector of char
  • function -> vector of function

  • vector -> string! (using conversions)

  • string -> vector of char
Generated on Tue Jun 29 14:31:10 2004 for stdGYS by 1.3.3
